what: Access and Analyze Data from the Red Book of Endemic Plants of Peru
title: Access and Analyze Data from the Red Book of Endemic Plants of Peru
text: R package redbookperu provides convenient access information contained Red Book Endemic Plants Peru. book represents comprehensive compilation data Peru’s endemic plant species, encompassing records 5,507 distinct taxa. Although document marked milestone consolidating ambitious initiative focused understanding diversity Peru’s endemic plant species time publication, currently requires review update presented taxonomic information. process accessing data original publication can pose challenges researchers, particularly due large number taxa presented within . redbookperu package primary objective addressing challenges providing updated taxonomic information. Additionally, introduces functions designed enhance accessibility usefulness data presented Red Book Endemic Plants Peru. information included redbookperu package built support Taxonomic Name Resolution Service TNRS, collaboration World Checklist Vascular Plants WCVP database. resources utilized ensure validity standardization taxonomic information provide.

title: Access and Analyze Data from the Red Book of Endemic Plants of Peru
text: can install redbookperu package CRAN using: can install development version redbookperu GitHub:

title: Access and Analyze Data from the Red Book of Endemic Plants of Peru
text: installing redbookperu package, can load R session using: determine species interest listed Red Book Endemic Plants Peru, provide check_redbook() function. function verifies whether species interest included book’s species list. function comes two variations: Species Name: Provides currently accepted name species. Taxonomic Status: Includes following categories: “Accepted name” species name recorded remains valid currently, “Updated name” species whose scientific name recorded time publication now considered synonymous, “opinion” species whose name presents difficulties determining current taxonomic status, “Non info. available” species updated information hasn’t found WCVP database. species interest doesn’t match species list, response “endemic”. check_redbook(splist, tax_status == FALSE): result indicates whether species endemic , based match species present database. functions indicate presence partial matches (fuzzy match) name species interest varies compared information present database. check_redbook() function designed work seamlessly tibbles, allowing users easily analyze species data within tabular format. intend access information provided species listed Red Book Endemic Plants Peru, option use get_redbook_data() function. function facilitates association updated taxonomic information details concerning conservation status, distribution, descriptions presented original publication.
code: library(redbookperu) #> This is redbookperu 0.0.2 splist <- c("Aphelandra cuscoenses", "Sanchezia capitata",             "Sanchezia ovata", "Piper stevensi",             "Verbesina andinaa", "Verbesina andina", "Weinmania nubigena")  redbookperu::check_redbook(splist, tax_status = TRUE) #> [1] "Aphelandra cuscoensis - Accepted name - Fuzzy match" #> [2] "Sanchezia ovata - Updated name"                      #> [3] "Sanchezia ovata - Not endemic"                       #> [4] "Piper stevensii - No opinion - Fuzzy match"          #> [5] "Verbesina andina - No info. available - Fuzzy match" #> [6] "Verbesina andina - No info. available"               #> [7] "Weinmania nubigena - Not endemic" redbookperu::check_redbook(splist, tax_status = FALSE) #> [1] "Endemic - fuzzy match" "Endemic"               "Not endemic"           #> [4] "Endemic - fuzzy match" "Endemic - fuzzy match" "Endemic"               #> [7] "Not endemic" tibble::tibble(splist = splist) |>    dplyr::mutate(endemic_tax_status = redbookperu::check_redbook(splist, tax_status = FALSE),                 endemic = redbookperu::check_redbook(splist, tax_status = TRUE)) #> # A tibble: 7 × 3 #>   splist                endemic_tax_status    endemic                            #>   <chr>                 <chr>                 <chr>                              #> 1 Aphelandra cuscoenses Endemic - fuzzy match Aphelandra cuscoensis - Accepted … #> 2 Sanchezia capitata    Endemic               Sanchezia ovata - Updated name     #> 3 Sanchezia ovata       Not endemic           Sanchezia ovata - Not endemic      #> 4 Piper stevensi        Endemic - fuzzy match Piper stevensii - No opinion - Fu… #> 5 Verbesina andinaa     Endemic - fuzzy match Verbesina andina - No info. avail… #> 6 Verbesina andina      Endemic               Verbesina andina - No info. avail… #> 7 Weinmania nubigena    Not endemic           Weinmania nubigena - Not endemic redbookperu::get_redbook_data(c("Sanchecia capitata",                    "Weinmania nubigena",                    "Macroclinium christensonii",                    "Weberbauera violacea")) #>                name_subitted              accepted_name accepted_family #> 1         Sanchecia capitata            Sanchezia ovata     Acanthaceae #> 2         Weinmania nubigena                       nill            nill #> 3 Macroclinium christensonii Macroclinium christensonii     Orchidaceae #> 4       Weberbauera violacea       Weberbauera violacea    Brassicaceae #>   accepted_name_author               redbook_name        iucn #> 1          Ruiz & Pav.         Sanchezia capitata          DD #> 2                 nill                       nill        nill #> 3            D.E.Benn. Macroclinium christensonii CR, B1abiii #> 4           Al-Shehbaz       Weberbauera violacea          DD #>                                   publication #> 1 Bull. Herb. Boissier, ser. 2, 4: 315. 1904. #> 2                                        nill #> 3    Brittonia 46(3): 249 - 251, f. 13. 1994. #> 4         Novon 14(3): 266 - 268, f. 3. 2004. #>                              collector herbariums  common_name dep_registry #> 1                  A. Mathews 1230 (K)       <NA> Desconocido.      JU - PA #> 2                                 nill       nill         nill         nill #> 3 O. del Castillo ex D.E. Bennett 5160        NY. Desconocido.           JU #> 4        A. Sagástegui A. et al. 11175  MO; HUT!. Desconocido.           CA #>                ecological_regions      sinampe peruvian_herbariums #> 1 BMHP, BHA; altitud desconocida. Sin registro            Ninguno. #> 2                            nill         nill                nill #> 3                   BMHM; 1800 m. Sin registro            Ninguno. #> 4                    PAR; 3800 m. Sin registro      HUT (isotipo). #>                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             remarks #> 1               Esta especie arbustiva es conocida de dos localidades. La colección tipo fue recolectada en la cuenca del Pangoa en el siglo XVIII. Probablemente la expansión urbana y las actividades agrícolas sean problemas para esta especie. #> 2                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              nill #> 3 Esta hierba epífita es conocida sólo de la colección tipo, proveniente del valle de Chanchamayo, en una subcuenca del Perené. Esta región ha sufrido continuas reducciones de sus áreas naturales debido a la ampliación de la frontera agrícola. #> 4                                                            Esta hierba paramuna es conocida de la localidad tipo, en la cuenca del Crisnejas, un tributario del Marañón. El ejemplar tipo fue recolectado en 1983, de una jalca poco herborizada.

what: Check Species Names in the Red Book of Endemic Plants of Peru — check_redbooklist
title: Check Species Names in the Red Book of Endemic Plants of Peru — check_redbooklist
text: function checks list species names Red Book Endemic Plants Peru database provides information whether species recorded endemic, checks misspelling typos (fuzzy match).

title: Check Species Names in the Red Book of Endemic Plants of Peru — check_redbooklist
Check Species Names in the Red Book of Endemic Plants of Peru — check_redbooklist
text: splist character vector containing species names checked. dist Maximum allowed distance fuzzy matching species names.

title: Check Species Names in the Red Book of Endemic Plants of Peru — check_redbooklist
text: character vector indicating input species name listed "endemic" Red Book Endemic Plants Peru database. Returns "endemic" species name listed "endemic" matching entry found.

title: Check Species Names in the Red Book of Endemic Plants of Peru — check_redbooklist
text: function checks species name provided list Red Book Endemic Plants Peru database using fuzzy matching based specified maximum distance (dist). provides information endemic status species flags recorded name needs updating. also counts number exact fuzzy matches found.

title: Check Species Names in the Red Book of Endemic Plants of Peru — check_redbooklist
text: Red Book Endemic Plants Peru World Checklist Vascular Plants, continuously updated resource exploring global plant diversity. Taxonomic Name Resolution Service - TNRS Plants World Online - Facilitated Royal Botanic Gardens - Kew.

title: Check Species Names in the Red Book of Endemic Plants of Peru — check_redbooklist
code: # Example usage of the function splist <- c("Aphelandra cuscoenses",             "Piper stevensi",             "Sanchezia ovata",             "Verbesina andina",             "Festuca dentiflora",             "Eucrosia bicolor var. plowmanii",             "Hydrocotyle bonplandii var. hirtipes",             "Persea americana")  # Basic usage check_redbooklist(splist = splist, dist = 0.2) #> Total exact matches: 4 #> Total fuzzy matches: 2 #> [1] "endemic"     "endemic"     "not endemic" "endemic"     "endemic"     #> [6] "endemic"     "endemic"     "not endemic"  # Using base R with a data frame plant_list <- data.frame(splist = splist) plant_list$label <- check_redbooklist(plant_list$splist, dist = 0.2) #> Total exact matches: 4 #> Total fuzzy matches: 2 plant_list #>                                 splist       label #> 1                Aphelandra cuscoenses     endemic #> 2                       Piper stevensi     endemic #> 3                      Sanchezia ovata not endemic #> 4                     Verbesina andina     endemic #> 5                   Festuca dentiflora     endemic #> 6      Eucrosia bicolor var. plowmanii     endemic #> 7 Hydrocotyle bonplandii var. hirtipes     endemic #> 8                     Persea americana not endemic

what: Get Red Book Data for Given Species List — get_redbook_data
title: Get Red Book Data for Given Species List — get_redbook_data
text: function retrieves comprehensive information Red Book Endemic Plants Peru database provided list species. associates provided species names corresponding updated taxonomic information descriptions recorded original publication.

title: Get Red Book Data for Given Species List — get_redbook_data
Get Red Book Data for Given Species List — get_redbook_data
text: splist character vector containing species names queried. dist Maximum allowed distance fuzzy matching species names.

title: Get Red Book Data for Given Species List — get_redbook_data
text: data frame containing comprehensive information provided species, including updated taxonomic details descriptions.

title: Get Red Book Data for Given Species List — get_redbook_data
text: function checks species name provided list Red Book Endemic Plants Peru database using fuzzy matching based specified maximum distance (dist). species, retrieves combines taxonomic information (accepted name, accepted family, accepted name author) additional descriptive data recorded original publication, IUCN conservation category, bibliographic reference, collector, herbariums, common name, departmental registrations, ecological regions, protected natural areas (SINANPE), Peruvian herbaria, additional remarks.

title: Get Red Book Data for Given Species List — get_redbook_data
text: Red Book Endemic Plants Peru World Checklist Vascular Plants, continuously updated resource exploring global plant diversity. Taxonomic Name Resolution Service - TNRS Plants World Online - Facilitated Royal Botanic Gardens - Kew.

title: Get Red Book Data for Given Species List — get_redbook_data
code: # Example illustrating how to use the get_redbook_data function species_list <- c("Aphelandra cuscoensis", "Sanchezia ovata", "Piper stevensii") redbook_data <- get_redbook_data(species_list) head(redbook_data) #>           name_subitted         accepted_name accepted_name_author #> 1 Aphelandra cuscoensis Aphelandra cuscoensis               Wassh. #> 2       Sanchezia ovata                   ---                  --- #> 3       Piper stevensii       Piper stevensii                Trel. #>   accepted_family          redbook_name    iucn #> 1     Acanthaceae Aphelandra cuscoensis EN, B1a #> 2             ---                   ---     --- #> 3      Piperaceae       Piper stevensii    <NA> #>                                          publication          collector #> 1                 Phytologia 25(7): 469 - 470. 1973. C. Vargas C. 15415 #> 2                                                ---                --- #> 3 Field Mus. Nat. Hist., Bot. Ser. 13(2): 237. 1936.    F.L. Stevens 85 #>   herbariums  common_name dep_registry              ecological_regions #> 1       (US) Desconocido.           CU                 BHA; 470—520 m. #> 2        ---          ---          ---                             --- #> 3       ILL. Desconocido.           JU Sin datos; altitud desconocida. #>        sinampe peruvian_herbariums #> 1          PNM            CUZ (1). #> 2          ---                 --- #> 3 Sin registro            Ninguno. #>                                                                                                                                                                         remarks #> 1 Hierba terrestre conocida solamente del sur del país, de las cuencas del Marcapata y del Madre de Dios. Aparentemente no ha vuelto a ser recolectada desde la década de 1960. #> 2                                                                                                                                                                           --- #> 3                              Este taxón fue considerado por Brako & Zarucchi (1993) como un endemismo; sin embargo, no ha sido posible evaluarlo, ni asignarle una categoría.

what: Database of the Red Book of Endemic Plants of Peru — redbook_sp_data
title: Database of the Red Book of Endemic Plants of Peru — redbook_sp_data
text: database contains comprehensive information regarding endemic plant species listed Red Book Endemic Plants Peru. endemic taxon accompanied corresponding variables detail taxonomic status, IUCN conservation category, bibliographic references, type collection details, common names, departmental registrations, ecological regions, protected natural areas (SINANPE), Peruvian herbaria specimens deposited, recorded original book.

title: Database of the Red Book of Endemic Plants of Peru — redbook_sp_data
Database of the Red Book of Endemic Plants of Peru — redbook_sp_data
text: data frame following variables: redbook_id Unique identifier species Red Book Endemic Plants Peru. redbook_name Scientific name endemic species. iucn Conservation category assigned according IUCN. publication Bibliographic reference taxon originally described. collector Name(s) collector(s) type specimen. herbariums Acronyms institutions type specimens taxon deposited. common_name Common names species mentioned literature. dep_registry Abbreviations departments taxon recorded. ecological_regions Abbreviations ecological regions proposed Zamora (1996). sinampe Abbreviation Protected Natural Area taxon recorded. peruvian_herbariums Acronyms Peruvian institutions type non-type specimens deposited. remarks Observations additional information endemic taxon.

title: Database of the Red Book of Endemic Plants of Peru — redbook_sp_data
text: database provides essential information research conservation efforts related Peru's endemic flora, offering access data presented corresponding book.

title: Database of the Red Book of Endemic Plants of Peru — redbook_sp_data
text: León, Blanca, et.al. 2006. “Red Book Endemic Plants Peru”. Revista Peruana De Biología 13 (2): 9s-22s. https://revistasinvestigacion.unmsm.edu.pe/index.php/rpb/issue/view/153

Varga… (US)       Desconocid… #> 2 2APHA      Aphelandra hapa… CR, … Phytologia… R. Ferre… NA         Desconocid… #> 3 3APJU      Aphelandra juni… CR, … Phytologia… A. Weber… NA         Desconocid… #> 4 4APLA      Aphelandra lati… VU, … Phytologia… R. Ferre… NA         Desconocid… #> 5 5APVI      Aphelandra visc… EN, … Repert. Sp… A. Raimo… (B)        Desconocid… #> 6 6APWE      Aphelandra webe… EN, … Notizbl. B… A. text: redbook_sps_class dataset includes species names separated genus, epithet, author, subspecies, variety, position (ID) redbook_tab.

title: List of Species Names in redbook_sps_class Separated by Category — redbook_sps_class
List of Species Names in redbook_sps_class Separated by Category — redbook_sps_class
text: data.frame following columns: species character vector. full species name. genus character vector. genus species. epithet character vector. specific epithet species. input_subspecies_epitheton character vector. infraspecific epithet species, applicable. rank character vector. taxonomic rank (e.g., "species", "subspecies", "variety"). subspecies character vector. subspecies name, applicable. variety character vector. variety name, applicable. hybrid character vector. Indicates species hybrid. id character vector. ID species redbook_tab.

what: Species Names Listed in The Red Book of Endemic Plants of Peru — redbook_tab
title: Species Names Listed in The Red Book of Endemic Plants of Peru — redbook_tab
text: redbook_tab contains records species listed Red Book Endemic Plants Peru.

title: Species Names Listed in The Red Book of Endemic Plants of Peru — redbook_tab
Species Names Listed in The Red Book of Endemic Plants of Peru — redbook_tab
text: tibble following columns: redbook_id fixed species ID input taxon Red Book Endemic Plants Peru. redbook_name character vector. species name listed Red Book Endemic Plants Peru. input_genus character vector. input genus corresponding species name listed. input_epitheton character vector. specific epithet corresponding species name listed. rank character vector. taxonomic rank (e.g., "species", "subspecies", "variety") corresponding species name listed. input_subspecies_epitheton character vector. infraspecific epithet corresponding species name listed, applicable. accepted_name character vector. accepted plant taxa names according World Checklist Vascular Plants (WCVP). accepted_family character vector. corresponding family name accepted name. accepted_name_author character vector. author accepted name. accepted_name_rank character vector. rank accepted name (e.g., species, subspecies). tag_subsp_wcvp character vector. tag indicating subspecies recognized WCVP. genus_ephitethon_wcvp character vector. genus part name according WCVP. species_ephitethon_wcvp character vector. specific epithet part name according WCVP. subspecies_ephitethon_wcvp character vector. infraspecific epithet part name according WCVP, applicable.

title: Species Names Listed in The Red Book of Endemic Plants of Peru — redbook_tab
text: León, Blanca, et.al. 2006. “Red Book Endemic Plants Peru”. Revista Peruana De Biología 13 (2): 9s-22s. https://doi.org/10.15381/rpb.v13i2.1782.

what: Search Species Names in “The Red Book of Endemic Plants of Peru” — search_redbook
title: Search Species Names in “The Red Book of Endemic Plants of Peru” — search_redbook
text: function allows searching plant taxa names listed "Red Book Endemic Plants Peru". connects data listed catalog validates species present, removing orthographic errors plant names.

title: Search Species Names in “The Red Book of Endemic Plants of Peru” — search_redbook
code: search_redbook(   splist,   max_distance = 0.2,   show_correct = FALSE,   genus_fuzzy = FALSE,   grammar_check = FALSE )

title: Search Species Names in “The Red Book of Endemic Plants of Peru” — search_redbook
text: splist character vector specifying input taxon, element including genus specific epithet , potentially, infraspecific rank, infraspecific name, author name. valid characters allowed (see base::validEnc). max_distance integer fraction specifying maximum distance allowed comparing submitted name closest name matches species listed "Red Book Endemic Plants Peru". distance used generalized Levenshtein distance indicating total number insertions, deletions, substitutions allowed match two names. example, name length 10 max_distance = 0.1 allows one change (insertion, deletion, substitution). max_distance = 2 allows two changes. show_correct TRUE, column added final result indicating whether binomial name exactly matched (TRUE) misspelled (FALSE). genus_fuzzy TRUE, allows fuzzy matching genus level. grammar_check TRUE, performs grammar check species names.

title: Search Species Names in “The Red Book of Endemic Plants of Peru” — search_redbook
text: data frame matched species names additional information redbook catalog. match found, warning issued suggesting increase max_distance argument.

title: Search Species Names in “The Red Book of Endemic Plants of Peru” — search_redbook
text: function tries match names "Red Book Endemic Plants Peru", corresponding accepted valid name (accepted_name). input name valid name, duplicated accepted_name column. algorithm first try exactly match binomial names provided splist. match found, try find closest name given maximum distance defined max_distance. Note binomial names valid characters allowed function.

title: Search Species Names in “The Red Book of Endemic Plants of Peru” — search_redbook
text: León, Blanca, et.al. 2006. “Red Book Endemic Plants Peru”. Revista Peruana De Biología 13 (2): 9s-22s. https://doi.org/10.15381/rpb.v13i2.1782.
